title: Error Handling
subject: Angular
theory: Handling errors gracefully is vital. Angular provides a global ErrorHandler class that can be intercepted. For HTTP, RxJS `catchError` is used to handle stream failures without crashing the app.

examples.explanation: Intercepts the error notification and can log it or display a user-friendly message.

interview_questions.question: How do you implement global error logging?
interview_questions.answer: By creating a class implementing ErrorHandler and providing it in the root module.

real_world_use_cases.description: Showing a red toast message whenever an API call fails 500.

summary: Proper error handling prevents white screens of death and improves user trust.
